page.title: 19RECREATION
page.content: If you live in South or West Belfast and want to swim, play indoor or outdoor games, join a craft class,or take your child to a playgroup then the place to go is the Olympia Leisure Centre. It is in the Boucher Road, built on part of the Bog Meadows and was opened in 1983. About 4000 people use it every week. Indoors there is a main hall for sport, concerts etc., a large swimming pool, a social area and snack bar, a craft room, an exercise room as well as the playcentre for young children. Outdoors there is a floodlit all-weather sports pitch and a running track. Many local schools and youth organisations use the centre and many school children spend much of their summer holiday taking part in the special summer scheme activities.
